00.orig_text: Russian markets to remain closed until Friday
00.text: Russian markets to remain closed until Friday

02.orig_text: The Russian government has continued to hold all stock markets closed until Friday, including the MICEX and RTS exchanges.
02.text: The Russian government has continued to hold all stock markets closed until Friday, including the MICEX and RTS exchanges.

03.orig_text: Facing its worst financial crisis since 1989, the government is fighting to stem off a crash and restore consumer confidence.
03.text: Facing its worst financial crisis since 1989, the government is fighting to stem off a crash and restore consumer confidence.

04.orig_text: President Dmitry Medvedev went on national television to appease the public.
04.text: President Dmitry Medvedev went on national television to appease the public.

05.orig_text: ``There is no more important task for Russian authorities than stability of our financial system under the current circumstances.
05.text: ``There is no more important task for Russian authorities than stability of our financial system under the current circumstances.

06.orig_text: This is our top priority,`` Medvedev said.
06.text: This is our top priority,`` Medvedev said.

07.orig_text: ``The market should be given all the necessary support.``
07.text: ``The market should be given all the necessary support.``

08.orig_text: Finance Minister Alexei Kudrin announced that 500 billion rubles (US$ 19.7 billion) would be infused into the stock markets when they opened on Friday, with half of that amount coming from the federal budget.
08.text: Finance Minister Alexei Kudrin announced that 500 billion rubles (US$ 19.7 billion) would be infused into the stock markets when they opened on Friday, with half of that amount coming from the federal budget.

09.orig_text: In addition, the Central Bank responded by offering to loan an additional 60 billion rubles (US $2.63 billion) on top of the 1.13 trillion rubles (US$ 44.6 billion) that it offered yesterday to Sberbank, VTB Group and Gazprombank.
09.text: In addition, the Central Bank responded by offering to loan an additional 60 billion rubles (US $2.63 billion) on top of the 1.13 trillion rubles (US$ 44.6 billion) that it offered yesterday to Sberbank, VTB Group and Gazprombank.

10.orig_text: The Central Bank is encouraging the nations top banks to provide the money to smaller lenders.
10.text: The Central Bank is encouraging the nations top banks to provide the money to smaller lenders.

11.orig_text: Central Bank chairman Sergei Ignatiev also announced on Wednesday that mandatory reserve requirements for banks would be slashed, freeing up an additional 300 billion ruble.
11.text: Central Bank chairman Sergei Ignatiev also announced on Wednesday that mandatory reserve requirements for banks would be slashed, freeing up an additional 300 billion ruble.

12.orig_text: ``We hope that banks will spend these funds not on long-term crediting or other kinds of crediting of clients,`` he said, ``but on the maintenance of the necessary volume of their liquidity and on making settlements.``
12.text: ``We hope that banks will spend these funds not on long-term crediting or other kinds of crediting of clients,`` he said, ``but on the maintenance of the necessary volume of their liquidity and on making settlements.``

13.orig_text: In the aftermath of Russia's invasion of neighboring Georgia, the markets saw investors pull out nearly US$ 36 billion in wealth since early August.
13.text: In the aftermath of Russia's invasion of neighboring Georgia, the markets saw investors pull out nearly US$ 36 billion in wealth since early August.

14.orig_text: Further compounding economic woes are the recent slump in oil and gas prices, which have bolstered Russia's economy for several years.
14.text: Further compounding economic woes are the recent slump in oil and gas prices, which have bolstered Russia's economy for several years.

15.orig_text: To help with this, starting on October 1 regulators will lower the export duty on oil, saving Russian oil companies around US$ 5.5 billion.
15.text: To help with this, starting on October 1 regulators will lower the export duty on oil, saving Russian oil companies around US$ 5.5 billion.
